definition: chief offender/main culprit
disaster/misfortune/calamity
head/chief/first (occasion, thing etc)/classifier for poems, songs etc
criminal ringleader, main offender (idiom); main culprit/fig. main cause of a disaster
main offender, criminal ringleader (idiom); main culprit/fig. main cause of a disaster

sentences.english: She still thinks he was the culprit of torching his Long Island mansion.
sentences.chinese: 她仍然認爲50分是燃燒他的長島大廈的罪魁禍首。

sentences.english: The culprit is a hormone called Neuropeptide Y, or NPY.
sentences.chinese: 罪魁禍首是一種叫Y型神經肽或者NPY的荷爾蒙。

sentences.english: All it takes is a flying champagne cork or a shooting rubber band.
sentences.chinese: 飛起的香檳軟木塞或者彈起的橡皮筋都可能是禍首。

sentences.english: In China, nothing quite kills the romance like the threat of losing real estate.
sentences.chinese: 在中國，扼殺浪漫的罪魁禍首當屬房產歸屬權。

sentences.english: Unquestionably, the united army is the chief criminal of the plunder.
sentences.chinese: 英法聯軍無疑是最先搶掠圓明園的罪魁禍首。

sentences.english: Some say Barbie is responsible for breast implants and eating disorders.
sentences.chinese: 有人說芭比娃娃是引起隆胸和飲食無規律的罪魁禍首。

sentences.english: The cause of the warming was "dominated" by greenhouse gases emitted by human activity, said Stott.
sentences.chinese: 變暖的最大禍首是人類活動釋放的溫室氣體。

sentences.english: Everybody screws up, but i'm the screw-up.
sentences.chinese: 每個人都捅了簍子，但我是罪魁禍首。

sentences.english: If someone was throwing spitballs I could guess the culprit's name.
sentences.chinese: 如果有人扔唾沫紙團，我能猜出罪魁禍首的名字。

sentences.english: The scientists believe that rising sea surface temperatures are to blame.
sentences.chinese: 科學家們認爲，不斷上升的海面溫度是罪魁禍首。

sentences.english: As the ringleader, you are also grounded for a month.
sentences.chinese: 作爲罪魁禍首，你要被禁足一個月。

sentences.english: The culprit was volcanic ash from Mount Pelée in Martinique.
sentences.chinese: 罪魁禍首是馬提尼克島培雷火山釋放的火山灰。

sentences.english: And triglycerides high is the chief culprit of vascular sclerosis.
sentences.chinese: 而甘油三脂水平高正是血管硬化的罪魁禍首。

sentences.english: Stunting can have many causes, but iodine deficiency is a prime culprit.
sentences.chinese: 發育不良的原因有多種，但碘缺乏是罪魁禍首。

sentences.english: According to statistics, "Three Violations" is the main criminal and disasters of accidents.
sentences.chinese: 據統計，“三違”是安全生產事故的主要罪魁禍首。

sentences.english: Taxis and, yes, limos are culprits.
sentences.chinese: 她說的沒錯，出租車和豪華轎車就是罪魁禍首。

definition: to slander/to smear/to vilify
bring order out of chaos/set to rights things which have been thrown into disorder
to run a newspaper/to publish a newspaper
to lose one's job/unemployment/not to fulfill one's obligations/to neglect one's job/dereliction of duty
could happen at any moment/on the verge
variant of 勸誡|劝诫[quan4 jie4]
accomplice/accessory
to overcorrect (idiom)/to overcompensate
chaotic situation
to purge
misconception/fallacy
strict/serious/solemn/dignified/to tidy up/to clean up/to purge/to adjust
criminal ringleader, main offender (idiom); main culprit/fig. main cause of a disaster
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
Guoxing or Kuohsing township in Nantou county 南投縣|南投县[Nan2 tou2 xian4], central Taiwan
to be reluctant to give up a post
